symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses.name: Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis
diagnoses.description: A rare but potentially fatal disorder caused by excessive activation of macrophages and lymphocytes, leading to severe hyperinflammation. It can present with fever, cytopenias, hepatosplenomegaly, and lymphadenopathy. The disease often leads to severe infections due to an impaired immune response.

diagnoses.name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
diagnoses.description: A common type of anemia characterized by a deficiency in iron, leading to a decreased production of hemoglobin. This can cause fatigue, weakness, and increased susceptibility to infections. Iron deficiency anemia could coexist with or be a cause of hypoferritinemia.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect any part of the body, including the lungs (leading to pneumonia), lymph nodes (causing lymphadenopathy), and the immune system (increasing susceptibility to infections). Anxiety can also be a secondary issue related to dealing with a chronic condition.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) leads to Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS), which damages the immune system. It increases the risk of infections (such as pneumonia), causes lymphadenopathy, and can lead to various systemic symptoms, including anxiety.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease characterized by the growth of granulomas (clusters of inflammatory cells) in various parts of the body, commonly affecting the lungs and lymph nodes. It can lead to an increased susceptibility to infections and general fatigue, potentially contributing to anxiety.

diagnoses.name: Tuberculosis
diagnoses.description: A bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. It primarily affects the lungs (causing pneumonia) but can also affect the lymphatic system (causing lymphadenopathy), among others. The systemic effects of the disease can cause various symptoms including fatigue and anxiety.

diagnoses.name: Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that begins in the lymphatic system, notably the lymph nodes, leading to lymphadenopathy. It can weaken the immune system, increasing susceptibility to infections. Some treatments can lead to hypoferritinemia.

diagnoses.name: Common Variable Immunodeficiency
diagnoses.description: A disorder that impairs the immune system, leading to an increased risk of infections, including pneumonia. Patients with CVID may have lymphadenopathy and can experience chronic anxiety due to repeated health issues.

diagnoses.name: Iron Refractory Iron Deficiency Anemia (IRIDA)
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder causing iron deficiency anemia that does not improve with oral iron treatment. It involves hypoferritinemia and can indirectly increase susceptibility to infections due to weakened physical condition.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Granulomatous Disease
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder affecting the immune system's ability to fight certain types of bacteria and fungi, leading to severe infections such as pneumonia. The disease can also cause lymphadenopathy and includes symptoms like fatigue and anxiety due to the chronic nature of the disease and frequent infections.

diagnoses.name: Hemorrhoids
diagnoses.description: Swollen and inflamed veins in the rectum and anus that cause discomfort and bleeding. Often associated with straining during bowel movements, obesity, or pregnancy.

diagnoses.name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
diagnoses.description: A common, chronic, and long-lasting disorder in which a person has uncontrollable, reoccurring thoughts (obsessions) and behaviors (compulsions) that he or she feels the urge to repeat over and over.

diagnoses.name: Otitis Media
diagnoses.description: An infection of the air-filled space behind the eardrum (the middle ear). Common in children, it can cause ear pain, fever, and hearing problems.

diagnoses.name: Periodontal Disease
diagnoses.description: An infection of the structures around the teeth, including the gums, periodontal ligament, and alveolar bone. It's typically caused by poor brushing and flossing habits that allow plaque—a sticky film of bacteria—to build up on the teeth and harden.

diagnoses.name: Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder
diagnoses.description: A sexual dysfunction causing a lack of sexual fantasies and desire for sexual activity, resulting in personal distress or interpersonal difficulties.

diagnoses.name: Major Depressive Disorder
diagnoses.description: A mood disorder causing a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest. It affects how you feel, think, and handle daily activities.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety Disorders
diagnoses.description: A group of mental illnesses that cause constant and overwhelming anxiety and fear. Such disorders can significantly impair daily activities.

diagnoses.name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)
diagnoses.description: Characterized by persistent and excessive worry about a number of different things such as personal health, work, social interactions, and everyday routine life circumstances.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Stress
diagnoses.description: A condition resulting from a consistent state of worry and tension over a long period of time. It can lead to other health problems, including mental health disorders, cardiovascular disease, obesity, and menstrual issues.

diagnoses.name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
diagnoses.description: A common type of anemia—a condition in which blood lacks adequate healthy red blood cells. Red blood cells carry oxygen to the body's tissues. Symptoms can include fatigue, skin pallor, shortness of breath, light-headedness, dizziness, or a fast heartbeat.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones. Hypothyroidism may not cause noticeable symptoms in the early stages, but over time, untreated hypothyroidism can cause a number of health problems, such as obesity, joint pain, infertility, and heart disease.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Kidney Disease
diagnoses.description: A condition characterized by a gradual loss of kidney function over time. It can cause a variety of symptoms, including fluid retention leading to edema, unexplained weight gain due to the retention of fluids and waste, fatigue and weakness from anemia, and possibly hearing loss due to complications or associated conditions.

diagnoses.name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
diagnoses.description: A common type of anemia, a condition in which blood lacks adequate healthy red blood cells. Red blood cells carry oxygen to the body's tissues. Symptoms can include general fatigue, weakness, and migratory pruritus due to the lack of oxygenation in various tissues.

diagnoses.name: Polycythemia Vera
diagnoses.description: A type of blood cancer that causes the marrow to make too many red blood cells. These thickened blood can lead to symptoms like fatigue, itching (especially after a warm bath or shower), and unexplained weight gain due to increased blood volume and potentially associated diseases such as sleep apnea.

diagnoses.name: Celiac Disease
diagnoses.description: An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye. Over time, this reaction damages your small intestine's lining and prevents it from absorbing some nutrients (malabsorption). The intestinal damage often causes weight loss, fatigue, and anemia, but the condition can lead to weight gain in some cases. Dermatitis herpetiformis, a skin manifestation of celiac disease, may be related to migratory pruritus.

diagnoses.name: Heart Failure
diagnoses.description: A chronic, progressive condition in which the heart muscle is unable to pump enough blood to meet the body's needs for blood and oxygen. Heart failure can cause edema, fatigue from reduced oxygen delivery to tissues, and weight gain from fluid retention.

diagnoses.name: Liver Cirrhosis
diagnoses.description: A late stage of scarring (fibrosis) of the liver caused by many forms of liver diseases and conditions, such as hepatitis and chronic alcoholism. Cirrhosis can lead to a host of symptoms, including edema, weight gain from fluid retention, and anemia. Pruritus is a common symptom due to bile salts accumulating in the skin.

diagnoses.name: Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that begins in the lymphatic system, which is part of the immune system. It can cause symptoms such as unexplained weight gain, especially if lymphatic obstruction leads to edema, anemia from bone marrow involvement, and itchiness without an apparent rash.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Myeloma
diagnoses.description: A cancer that forms in a type of white blood cell called a plasma cell. Plasma cells help you fight infections by making antibodies that recognize and attack germs. Multiple myeloma causes cancer cells to accumulate in the bone marrow, where they crowd out healthy blood cells. It may cause symptoms like bone pain, weakness and fatigue from anemia, and weight gain due to related kidney problems.

diagnoses.name: Graves' Disease
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that results in the overproduction of thyroid hormones (hyperthyroidism). Though it typically causes weight loss, in some cases, it can result in weight gain. It can also cause a wide range of other symptoms, including fatigue and potentially hearing loss through its effects on the body's muscles and nerves.

diagnoses: Statins or other lipid-lowering medications-induced myopathy
Asthma exacerbated by an allergic reaction
Chemical Poisoning / Toxins (e.g., Histamine Fish Poisoning)
Inflammatory Bowel Disease (e.g., Crohn's Disease, Ulcerative Colitis)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS syndrome)
Gastrointestinal disorders with autonomic involvement (e.g., Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
Brain Tumor affecting the brainstem or cranial nerve pathways

diagnoses.name: Migraine with aura
diagnoses.description: A type of headache characterized by severe head pain accompanied by visual disturbances, such as flashes of light or blind spots, nausea, and sometimes vomiting and weakness.

diagnoses.name: Tension headache
diagnoses.description: A common type of headache that causes mild to moderate pain, often described as feeling like a tight band around the head. While tension headaches typically don’t cause nausea, they can occur concurrently with other conditions that might.

diagnoses.name: Cluster headaches
diagnoses.description: Severely painful headaches that occur in clusters, usually around one eye. They can be accompanied by symptoms such as eye watering, nasal congestion, and less commonly, nausea.

diagnoses.name: Stroke
diagnoses.description: A medical emergency that occurs when the blood supply to the brain is interrupted or reduced, causing brain cells to die. Symptoms can include headache, weakness, confusion, and visual disturbances.

diagnoses.name: Transient ischemic attack
diagnoses.description: Often called a mini-stroke, a TIA presents similar symptoms to a stroke, such as weakness and speech difficulties, but typically lasts only a few minutes and causes no permanent damage.

diagnoses.name: Brain tumor
diagnoses.description: A mass or growth of abnormal cells in the brain. Symptoms can include headaches, nausea, vision problems, weakness, and seizures.

diagnoses.name: Multiple sclerosis
diagnoses.description: A disease of the central nervous system that disrupts the flow of information within the brain, and between the brain and body. Visual disturbances, weakness, and dizziness are common symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Hypertension
diagnoses.description: High blood pressure can occasionally cause headaches or vision problems. While not directly causing nausea, the stress of high blood pressure can lead to it.

diagnoses.name: Anemia
diagnoses.description: A condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues, causing fatigue, weakness, and sometimes headache and dizziness.

diagnoses.name: Temporal arteritis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of blood vessels, typically in the head, that can cause severe headaches, vision disturbances, and scalp tenderness.

diagnoses: Peripheral neuropathy, myopathy, hoarseness, and hearing loss
Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA, formerly known as Wegener's granulomatosis)
Viral Infections (e.g., Epstein-Barr virus, Hepatitis C)
Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia with Immune Thrombocytopenia
